direction.raw_text: : The sound of HELICOPTER ROTORS slicing through the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, God. . . FADE IN ON: An ARMY HELICOPTER as it soars over the thick LOUISIANA BAYOU. Lush and green only a day ago, the foliage below has been ripped to shreds. The kind of damage that can only be done by nature. SUPERIMPOSE:, FEBRUARY 2 - 0630 HOURS - 32 KILOMETERS NORTH OF FORT MCKINLEY, LOUISIANA INT. ARMY HELICOPTER (FLYING) -- SUNRISE Sitting next to the PILOT is COLONEL WILLIAM STYLES. Mid- 40's, normally gruff, but completely cowed by the damage below. The PILOT, unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurricane Beth, huh? Had    an ex-wife named Beth, this is pretty   much par for the course. This area    got the worst of it, I hope these   guys are all intact-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough, Lieutenant. SOMEONE'S P.O.V. - RUNNING through the underbrush - ducking branches, pushing through bushes, splashing through streams. LABORED BREATHING wheezes over the sound track. We're headed for a CLEARING... INT. ARMY HELICOPTER (FLYING) -- SUNRISE The Pilot pushes his stick forward, descending to tree level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming up on the pick-up. EXT. CLEARING -- DAWN TWO MEN emerge from the underbrush at a run. The BIGGER MAN carrying the wounded SMALLER MAN over his shoulder. Both in ragged army cadet fatigues - ripped, muddy, and bloody. The Bigger Man lowers the Smaller Man to the ground and unshoulders his M-16. Face panicked. The sound of the HELICOPTER approaching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ARMY HELICOPTER (FLYING) -- SUNRISE The unmistakable SOUND OF GUNFIRE from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit, that's live fire! As the Helicopter comes over the clearing, Styles and the Pilot squint down through the windscreen to see the Two Men, huddled together as BULLET HITS kick up DUST around them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's shooting at them- The Bigger Man raising his own his weapon and RETURNING FIRE. The Smaller Man frantically waving the Helicopter down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't see- Below, the Bigger Man still shooting and then he lowers his rifle and there's only SILENCE. No return fire. And then Styles sees why. A THIRD MAN. Lying by the treeline. Chest torn open by gunfire. Obviously dead. His clothes - the same fatigues the first two men are wearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was one of their own, he just Shot one of their own men-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was trying to shoot them-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get us on the ground! EXT. CLEARING -- SUNRISE As the Helicopter comes in for a landing, the Bigger Man kneels next to the Smaller Man, who bleeds from a bullet wound to the arm.  His face, pale, sweating. The Bigger Man wipes the Smaller Man's brow and speaks softly and seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready for this? The Smaller Man nods. INT. ROADHOUSE -- MORNING A full on shit-kicking dive.     Nearly empty, given the hour. A TELEVISION plays the morning    news over the bar.  Only two inhabitants - one a BARTENDER,    the other the lone CUSTOMER, smoking and picking at a plate    of criminally runny eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the truth, Vic. You made these with a blender, right? He grins and we get our first good look at TOM HARDY - Three day stubble, dark rings around his eyes, but a with strong jaw and steady voice. Not your average barfly. Somebody who maybe used to be somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't like 'em, don't eat 'em, don't make no damn difference to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that was like a quadruple negative? The Bartender takes the plate away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I at least have a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's ten thirty in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, if you've slept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the law - no liquor before noon. Could lose my license.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you mean "don't need no liquor license not taken away from me"? The Bartender smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurricane kept you up, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and I could've used the sleep. I'm supposed to meet people here tonight, try and get some work going. He stops, his attention suddenly on the TV.    A NEWSCASTER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...is expected to announce the grand jury indictments in the Guissepe Torres police corruption case as early as tomorrow afternoon. Speculations abound that up to ten former homicide detectives could be named in the proceedings-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Bartender turns the TV off hastily.   Embarrassed:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Hardy just looks away. The Bartender puts an empty glass down and fills it to the lip with bourbon. Hardy nods a "thank you" and reaches for the glass when the PAGER on his hip goes off. He checks the number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill Styles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old friend. Haven't talked to him in- 911. Can I use your phone? The Bartender hands him a cordless and Hardy dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Bill, it's Tom. Long time no. . . whoa, whoa, slow down. Yeah... yeah, of course I'll come. An hour. He hangs up and hands the phone back to the Bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? Hardy, obviously shaken by the call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go out to McKinley. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- MORNING Establishing. A sprawling five square mile compound nestled in the Louisiana backwoods. Also damaged by the Hurricane. HELICOPTERS loaded with emergency supplies land and take off, REPAIR CREWS work feverishly on damaged buildings, all while CADET PLATOONS complete morning drills around them. This is still a boot camp after all. SUPERIMPOSE: 1130 HOURS - FORT MCKINLEY BASIC TRAINING CENTER EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- MAIN GATE -- MORNING Styles stands waiting nervously just beyond the CHECKPOINT with WARRANT OFFICER JULIA OSBORNE - early 30's, attractive, close cropped hair and icy eyes. In the middle of protesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is totally unnecessary-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked to see a policeman, we're getting him a policeman .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this guy you called, he's not even Army-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's former Army and the best I've ever seen in a room. Besides, he knows the territory, we did Basic together here. (off her look) You've had three hours with Dunbar and haven't gotten a peep, we need to take a different tack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not Army, it's not official-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it's unofficial. He takes a hit from an ASTHMA INHALER, as a '71 PONTIAC GTO drives through the gate and pulls up. Hardy emerges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: his appearance) Doesn't get any unofficialer than that... The two old friends embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been better. (pause) I read about what's been happening With you... I should have called-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of trouble are you in? Styles looks at the ground.      Momentarily flustered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would I have called you if it wasn't? If there was any other way-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me what I can do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can get us some answers. Hardy takes off his sunglasses, noticing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Warrant Officer Julia Osborne, The closest thing we have to an in- House investigator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here you are going out of house. How's that make you feel, Jules?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hostile and uncooperative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic.   You want to tell me what's going on? INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- CORRIDORS MORNING Hardy follows Styles and Osborne. They pass SOLDIERS replacing broken windows and sweeping up glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The official term for it is "Clusterfuck" . By the time Beth hit us, I'd canceled all off base exercises save one - a six man cadet team and their Drill out in the bush. We're missing three and the Sergeant. The cadets are in their eighth week of the cycle, nobody here knows much about them, up to and including their names. But the Sergeant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not West, is it?    Tell me it's not West. Styles' look tells him it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Christ
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew Sergeant West?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was our Drill here.    Man's older than sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few years ago, the Army picked our good buddy as their go to non-com to trot out to the press to talk about the kinder, gentler military. He even did the standard video greeting played to all incoming Basic cadets across the country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's a good soldier. Osborne nods, agreeing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean that as a compliment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant West's served for twenty- Three years. He's the public face of the modern Army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you notice I'm not in the Army anymore. They round a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The exercise was one of his Section Eight "private sessions". Left around
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 32 KILOMETERS NORTH OF FORT MCKINLEY, LOUISIANA INT
FORT MCKINLEY BASIC TRAINING CENTER EXT

direction.raw_text: yesterday and were scheduled for pick up at 0630 this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the problem is you only got three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, the problem is one's dead, one's got a bullet in his arm, and one won't talk. The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm assuming that's what made him the dead one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cadet Roberto R. Nunez.   Killed right in front of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Search parties for the others are fanning out in a ten click radius from the pickup. If they're hurt and we can get to them in time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called the JAG Corps, the two cadets we retrieved are to be flown to D.C. On a transport leaving here at 1700- HARDY Which gives us about five hours. Why'd you call me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy in interrogation said he'd only talk to a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm the closest thing to it, right? Styles stops, turning to his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, bottom line: I let those kids go out there. If JAG shows up and I don't have any answers for them, my career is finished-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not gonna let that happen. Styles exhales, relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Osborne will brief you on the cadets. And Tom? (half-smile) It really is good to see you. INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- OSBORNE'S OFFICE -- MORNING Osborne and Hardy enter, stepping over broken glass and hurricane debris. Hardy looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta be honest, I love what you've Done with the place-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and the Colonel go back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got me through Basic and a lot of other stuff. I owe him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the Tom Hardy I've been reading about in the papers, right? New Orleans PD fired you for taking bribes from Guissepe Torres.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was for suspicion of bribery, it's really all in the wording-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wording and your friendship with the Colonel aside, I'm not comfortable having you involved in this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Subtlety really isn't one of you finer points, is it, Osborne? Osborne opens her mouth to reply but Hardy cuts her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three things. First - You don't have a choice. Second- I've never taken a bribe in my life. And Third - I'm still a little drunk from last night, so if I skip over the witty banter and move forward to straight hitting on you, try not to take offense. Tell me about the two guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurricane knocked out our Mainframe, so all we have are their dogtags. Cadets Raymond Dunbar and Levi Kendall-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Levi?   Who names their kid Levi-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senator Jonathan Kendall, of Ohio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ... Remind me to thank Bill for mentioning that on the phone-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kendall Junior is still  in surgery, so he won't be available  to answer for his name or anything  else for another hour - the cadet  we're talking to first is Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in interrogation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because interrogation rooms look suspiciously like interrogation rooms, which doesn't exactly put people at ease. Is he cute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Dunbar cute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pissed) That is the most unprofessional-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he handsome, self assured, carry himself well, does he look you in the eyes or down at the floor, does he have good bones, suggesting good breeding, does he slouch or sit up straight - these are important questions, as they reveal a great deal about this man's character so please get over yourself for two and a half seconds and tell me is he cute? Osborne stares at him.    She finally nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. At some point in there I'm gonna rub my nose. When I do, go at him with everything you got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good cop/bad cop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that. She starts to go make preparations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and Osborne? You have any donuts around here? INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- CORRIDOR -- MORNING As two M.P.'s escort RAYMOND DUNBAR (the "Bigger Man") into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. COFFEE ROOM -- MORNING A small cluttered room with the shades drawn. A folding table has been set up in the middle of it with a chair on each side. Dunbar takes a seat in the far chair. Takes in his surroundings as the MP's leave, locking the door. INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- CORRIDOR - MORNING Hardy and Osborne head towards the Coffee Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I questioned him for three hours and he didn't make a sound. You don't have a badge, he won't talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten bucks says I have him talking in under three minutes. Osborne starts the timer on her digital watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- MORNING Dunbar looks up as they enter.    Hardy smiles, cheerily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cadet Dunbar, good morning! I'm Tom Hardy and I believe you've already met Officer Osborne. I understand you had a rough time of it last night? No response.    Hardy takes a seat across from the cadet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not talking, huh? You probably just want to get some food and some sleep. They feed you yet? No response.    Hardy reaches into his pocket.   Pulls out a DONUT. Dunbar eyes it, wary but definitely wanting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. You can eat in front of someone and still not talk to them - my parents did it for years. Dunbar grabs the donut, wolfing it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want another one? No response.    Osborne looks to her watch - it's been a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe later. Ray, let me say this up front - I'm not a cop. Dunbar turns away, no longer interested.   Hardy continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to be, but that's beside the point. Who I am doesn't really matter; what matters is that right now, you're in a shitload of trouble. You understand that, right? No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I don't know if you did what you did in self defense and frankly I don't really care. I'm just doing a favor for Colonel Styles because he wants to know if anyone else who's still out there is in need of assistance. To be honest with you, though, I don't care about that either. Dunbar looks up at this, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know those guys, you do. They die, to me, it's like seeing a couple people died in a fire on the news - tragic, but it doesn't affect me. The only thing I care about is I agreed to do a favor for a friend and try and talk to you till your transpo shows up. You like baseball? No response.   Osborne looks at her watch - two minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could talk baseball for   days. Batting averages, ERA's, I   got statistics in my brain, I   don't know how I remember them. It's    freaky. You wanna talk baseball? Dunbar, completely confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Ray, we're gonna be here five hours, we gotta talk about something. So who do you like? A long silence and then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like baseball. Hardy grins as Osborne stops her watch at 2:41.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked for a policeman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're under military arrest, it's not gonna happen. What's wrong with baseball?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... too slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's a game of anticipation, that's the beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you like then? As they continue, we TRACK under the table to reveal a HIDDEN MICROPHONE... INT. STYLES' OFFICE -- MORNING Styles and an M.P. listening to the Coffee Room conversation. DUNBAR'S VOICE, over the speaker:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I like the Army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Ray, everyone hates the Army during Basic. I'll tell you straight, I hated it here. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- MORNING DUNBAR You did Basic here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen years ago under Sergeant West. Piece of work, that guy. I remember, he used to have these two silver .45's with ivory handles and if you weren't quick enough, he'd (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knock you on the head with one of them. He still carry those guns? He Dunbar nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was also his " knife dummy" . (to Osborne) See, West used to say he could slit a man from stem to sternum in three seconds. He'd use this length of pipe to demonstrate and if you were the knife dummy, you'd spend all day getting a pipe rammed into your balls if you weren't fast enough to defend yourself. That was a loooong day. Hardy laughs at the memory and turns back to Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incidentally, Ray, I promised them I'd ask where West and the others are. Can we get to them? He looks to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no need...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're dead, aren't they? Dunbar looks back up at Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. INT. STYLES' OFFICE -- MORNING Styles lowers his head at this. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- MORNING HARDY You kill them? No answer.    Hardy rubs his nose.   Osborne steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel saw you shoot Nunez, You're a murderer-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, Ray, this is what we call "good cop, bad cop". (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shouts, I stand up for you, you're grateful, a bond of trust is established. Osborne, stunned by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't want to play games. That's why you're not in an interrogation room, with one of those two way mirrors - everyone knows those things are two way, right? Dunbar looks at him good nods slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Now, I'm gonna go get you another donut and you think about whether you want to talk more, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Hardy smiles at him, gets up, and leaves. INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- CORRIDOR -- MORNING Osborne follows him out into the hall where Styles waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baseball?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe somebody owes me ten dollars-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made me look like an idiot-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't know the object of the interrogation is to make you look good- Everyone knows good cop, bad cop - by admitting it I appeared trustworthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes- They stop, looking at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got four hours and forty-five minutes to find out. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- MORNING Hardy returns, another donut in hand, Osborne behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you ask for a cop, Ray?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not telling you what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... but I would like to know about the other cadets. What they were like - nice guys? Dunbar takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about them. As Dunbar begins to talk, we FLASHBACK... EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- PARADE GROUNDS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO Row upon row of freshly shaven headed CADETS stand at attention. Their first day of boot camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First day was when I met Pike.    Sarge hated him from the beginning. A man with a face of granite strides up and down the lines. Two ivory handled pistols on his hips. His lifeless cobalt blue eyes take in the Cadets. This is SERGEANT WEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You motherfuckers have just made the worst mistake of your lives! You have chosen to join my Army! This Army is my mother, my father, and my little virgin sister and I will not allow anyone or anything that is not up to my standards near her pretty little virgin cooze, do you understand me - give me a sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those who I deem unworthy to pass through this camp will quit, and those who refuse to quit I will kill. You ever hear of a training accident - Give me a sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my time I have killed sixteen men for the good of my country, sixteen men whose entrance into this Army I could not condone, as it would weaken the fabric of this nation's defense! This base suffers an average of three training accidents a year, unfortunate incidents that I will not hesitate to repeat if you cross me, understand - Give me a sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So forget what you've seen on Sixty fucking Minutes about the kinder, gentler military - you will either succeed, quit, or die by my hand! He walks over to a tall black cadet in the front row.   PIKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My power here is absolute, isn't that right, nigger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir! West hauls off and SLAPS Pike across the face!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hail from Biloxi, Mississippi where we string greasy coon necks up from tree branches when the mood strikes us you have a problem with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, no, sir! West grabs Pike by the neck, CHOKING HIM. The others Cadets GASP. Pike goes down on his knees, the loss of air is so great. He reaches up automatically to try and save himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is this? You lay a hand on me while I'm trying to do my duty and rid the world of you? He KICKS PIKE IN THE BALLS and releases him. Pike goes fetal on the ground, VOMITING, as West stands over him, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck up, you're still in formation, get the fuck up! Pike somehow gets to his feet, vomit streaking his clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck have you done to that uniform, take it off, take it off, take it off! Pike, still gasping, can't move fast enough.    West slaps him again and tears the man's shirt off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get those fucking pants off, I want you buck ass naked, you don't deserve to wear these beautiful United States Army issue clothes! Pike struggles off the rest of his clothes until he is NAKED. West turns and spies Dunbar in the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cadet, what's your name!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, Dunbar, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how to work a pistol, Dunbar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir! West draws one of his PISTOLS and gives it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar you are to stand here and guard this nigger for the next twenty- four hours! He is not to be given food, water, or clothes! If he so much as moves, you are to blow his nigger brains out, is that clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest of you, fallout for physicals! The rest of the Cadets fallout, following West away to one of the buildings, leaving Dunbar and Pike. One with a gun, the other naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen guys quit that day.    But not Pike. EXT. OBSTACLE COURSE -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- MORNING The CADETS, navigating a log spanned over a PIT OF MUD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time went on and the Sarge started singling people out. One of the Cadets, a small man named ANDERSON, falls from the log. Screaming, West dives into the pit and pulls Anderson out, knocking him on the head with a pistol. EXT. TARMAC -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- AFTERNOON Anderson stands naked, his arms straining to hold up,TWO PAINT CANS perpendicular to his body as West berates him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd zero in on a fella and ride him till he quit. EXT. MAIN GATE -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- NIGHT Anderson, now in civilian clothes, gets into a TAXI.   Quit. EXT. FIRING RANGE -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- MORNING West, screaming at a weasely looking cadet named CHILDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those who wouldn't quit, he'd put in what he called Section Eight. INT. SECTION EIGHT BARRACKS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- NIGHT A horribly dilapidated quarters. Four cadets, Dunbar, Pike, Childs, and MUELLER sleep in rickety bunks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Washout rejects, guys he said were , "dumbfucks too stupid to know they were dead". He separated us from the rest. We slept alone...

direction.raw_text: . INT. MESS HALL -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- MORNING The same four Cadets, eating ON THE FLOOR as the other members of the Cadet Corps chow at tables.

direction.raw_text: . . .ate alone.. . EXT. REGULAR BARRACKS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- EVENING The four Cadets fallout on a run shirtless, with heavy packs and rifles held over their heads as the rest of the Cadet Corps files into their barracks for sleep.

direction.raw_text: ...and trained long after the other guys got to turn in. EXT. PARADE GROUNDS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO -- MORNING The Cadet Corps, mustered. West zeroes in on NUNEZ (the "dead one"), whose t-shirt has a spot on it.

direction.raw_text: Fellas lived in daily fear of being Sectioned and with good reason, too. West pulls Nunez out of line by his ear and kicks him over towards a separate muster of our Four Section Eighters.

direction.raw_text: They figured we were the boys who'd meet with a "training accident" . Nunez takes a place among them.   Looking absolutely terrified. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT DAY Osborne leans forward.

direction.raw_text: Are you saying Sergeant West tried to kill you?

direction.raw_text: . Dunbar gives a look that almost resembles a smile.

direction.raw_text: Mueller was from Tulsa, a real good ol' boy type. One of those "his Daddy's Daddy's Daddy died at Bull Run and no bleeding heart Yankee was gonna take away his scatter gun" . He idolized West. Muller, grinning, as West kicks his ass to pick up the pace. Next to him is NUNEZ, a strapping hulk of a manchild.

direction.raw_text: And Nunez idolized Mueller. Big fella from New Mexico. After he got Sectioned he just followed Mueller around like a lap dog. He wasn't mean like Mueller, though, didn't have it in him. Next to Nunez is CHILDS, small and weasely with feral eyes.

direction.raw_text: But Childs did. Didn't talk to anyone, but you got this feeling something was wrong with him, like real wrong. Type of guy you felt uncomfortable going to sleep near. Behind Childs runs Pike.

direction.raw_text: He'd been busted for Auto Theft, judge gave him the option of jailor the Army. He made the wrong choice. Next to Pike, Dunbar and KENDALL run side by side.   Kendall is short like Childs, but also weak. Wheezing.

direction.raw_text: Finally Kendall and me. Kendall was a smart guy, we got along okay. Pike and I tried to help him, but... Kendall falters and Pike stops to try and help him up. West smacks the him away, practically kicking Kendall to his feet.

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That's just the story I tell the girls to get them into bed. Truth is... I don't know. The whole honor and duty thing. Make a difference in the world, crap like that. Didn't really work out. Osborne studies him.

direction.raw_text: I bet    that's the second story you tell    the girls to get them into bed, after    you make them laugh with the first    one. Hardy just smiles.

direction.raw_text: No. INT. BASE HOSPITAL -- RECOVERY UNIT -- DAY A NURSE leads Hardy and Osborne down a spotless white hall.

direction.raw_text: Cadet Kendall-

direction.raw_text: . INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- DAY Hardy and Osborne sit across from Kendall's bed.

direction.raw_text: Sergeant West is dead isn't he? Kendall nods.

direction.raw_text: And the other three Cadets? Kendall hesitates, then nods again.

direction.raw_text: Feel free to elaborate . Kendall takes a breath and begins, all trace of bravado gone.

direction.raw_text: My father is a powerful man. Over the years he's used that power to protect me, in one form or another, from certain... unpleasantries. (deep breath) I am a homosexual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senator Daddy must be thrilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is not, shall we say, wild about the idea. He has asked me on numerous occasions to be more discreet about my proclivities, and I have done my best to oblige him. However, in the last four weeks, I began a relationship with another cadet. What do you think of that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you just blew "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" out of the fucking water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sergeant discovered this relationship and wanted me expelled. My father interceded, so instead, West Sectioned me and made sure every other cadet knew that I was gay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't kick you out so he wanted you to quit on your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted more than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More intrigue, Levi? Kendall stares at them, dead serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. INT. SECTION EIGHT BARRACKS -- LAST NIGHT The six Cadets asleep, all except Kendall, who stares up at the patchwork ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the regular Tuesday night drill. He'd let us sleep for an hour and then wake us up, drag us out to the bayou, and work us all night, separate from the others. The door SLAMS OPEN, revealing West.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up, get up, get up! We're going on a little night hike, boys - muster in five on the south tarmac! He leaves as the Sectioners rise, groaning.

direction.raw_text: Hurricane's due after midnight and we're still going out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toughens us up, Pike.    You don't like it, quit. Pike pulls on his pants and shoots him the finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we shouldn't go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The faggot speaks.

direction.raw_text: You really heard this?

direction.raw_text: You know Popham, works in the kitchen? He told me it was on the radio. He stops, listening.    They all hear the WIND, HOWLING outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should tell him we're not going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, "Excuse me, Sergeant, sir, we don't feel like going out - we don't want to get rained on." He'll kick our asses from here to Cleveland. He pulls on his rain poncho and is out the door, Nunez right behind him. The others, getting ready, all except Kendall. Dunbar comes over and puts a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right.    We don't have a choice. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- TARMAC -- LAST NIGHT The six cadets, mustered in front of West and a TRANSPORT CHOPPER. West hands out M-16's, sidearms, and grenades while yelling above the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rifle, a pistol, and three phosphorous grenades to a man! This is live fire, so keep those safetied until we touch down; I don't want anyone shooting their dick off! Some chuckling.

direction.raw_text: Some of you may have heard there's a hurricane coming! American soldiers do not wait for good weather - they do not wait for a bright sunshiney day to do their duty! An American Soldier learns to operate in the worst conditions and turn said conditions into an advantage against their enemy! Anyone who thinks these conditions are too harsh, feel free to lay down and die, you get me?

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is two clicks North of a cabin, you are to split into teams of two (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and work your way through your designated area blasting as many targets as you can find! Each area has twenty targets, first team to take all twenty and find the cabin wins! Teams are as follows - Dunbar and Nunez, Pike and Mueller, Kendall and Childs! Mueller groans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will be in the areas monitoring your progress and if I see anyone drag ass I will personally slit you stem to sternum and leave you for dead! Fall out! The Cadets board the Transport Chopper. Kendall gets on last, passing West who leans in and whispers to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna die tonight, faggot. INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY Osborne looks up.

direction.raw_text: He said what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You're gonna die tonight, faggot" . Clear as day.

direction.raw_text: Levi, I don't know   if you're familiar with investigative   work, but we have this little thing   called "motive" and you just gave   yourself one.

direction.raw_text: I wanted to tell someone what he'd said, but I couldn't. Mueller would just laugh. Nunez and Childs wouldn't care. Pike and Dunbar were okay, but... When West outed me, he isolated me. An outcast among outcasts. And I'd just been told tonight was the night I'd die. The Chopper touches down on the edge of the BAYOU. The door rumbles open as West points out different team directions in the blackness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First team, second team, third team, go, go, go! The click of rifles being unsafetied as the cadets pour out of the helicopter. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- LAST NIGHT We track with Kendall and Childs as they head away from the Landing Zoe, rifles up, heads down, side by side. Moving the brush quickly and quietly, eyes scanning for targets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew Childs a little, we worked at the PX together. The wind is picking up and it's started to RAIN.   Their ponchos flap loudly against the elements.

direction.raw_text: I started getting it in my head that maybe West had paid him, maybe he was the one who was supposed to give me a training accident- The ROAR of GUNFIRE!  Kendall turns  towards it,  SCREAMING for a moment... Until he sees Childs  lower his  smoking rifle, a SHREDDED TARGET on a tree in front  of them.   He looks down, noticing has his own weapon TRAINED  ON CHILDS.  .. Childs steps forward, knocking Kendall's rifle away.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm- I'm sorry. . . Kendall, terrified. Shaking. A beat. Childs picks up the rifle from the ground and hands it back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, let's move. VARIOUS SHOTS -- Kendall and Childs, moving through the bayou, Childs taking out targets. It's raining harder now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I could think of was West, out there somewhere in the dark. Maybe watching the others, maybe watching me. And waiting to make his move. Childs speaks, and Kendall almost jumps out of his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, am I alone in this world? Shoot something- A SOUND from the left. Kendall panics, pivots, and FIRES... Into DARKNESS. No target, no West, no nothing. Kendall, really freaked out now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A target, Kendall, cap a fucking target. What's wrong with you?

direction.raw_text: I thought I was gonna have an attack. Go into a fit and bite off my own tongue in the middle of the bayou. Childs could tell I wasn't right.

direction.raw_text: Just safety your shit and get behind me, okay? I'll take care of this. Kendall nods and lets Childs walk ahead. Staring at Childs' back as they move on. On Kendall's face, thinking...

direction.raw_text: Maybe it was a trick. Maybe this was when they'd get me, when I felt safest. CLOSE. ON KENDALL'S FINGER - Clicking off the safety again. Moving towards the trigger...

direction.raw_text: But if I struck first and took out Childs, then maybe I could make it out alive... Kendall raises the rifle.    Sights Childs' back.      A moment of utter silence and then... INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY KENDALL Maybe I shouldn't tell you that. Maybe I should tell you I wasn't scared at all. But I was... (long pause) Enough to almost kill him.

direction.raw_text: Over there! Childs points to the right, where the dim shine of PHOSPHOROUS can be seen through the trees. He drags Kendall to his feet and the two take off running towards it. Kendall panting and scared, ducking branches and leaping ditches as the two sprint towards the dying glow.

direction.raw_text: ! They hit the deck, face down in mud. It takes them a second to realize the shots are not directed at them.

direction.raw_text: What do we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't want to go-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Childs rises and heads towards where the sounds were. Kendall, lying in the rain and mud, shivering.    Alone.   After a moment he gets up and follows. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED,-- LAST NIGHT The SCORCHED GROUND and TREES smolder under the rainfall. Kendall finds Childs, standing down by the creek. Something lies by his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's- He stops, seeing.

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus.. . WEST. Literally spread out on the ground, dead. Eyes open, face half blackened, he has been ripped in two at the torso. A horrifying sight. Kendall stumbles back from it.

direction.raw_text: Did- Did you-

direction.raw_text: Hey, I- (seeing it) Holy fuck. .,. holy fuck, what the fuck did you guys do?

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Jesus fucking Christ... Muttering to himself, walking in circles.

direction.raw_text: We got- I don't know, we got separated

direction.raw_text: I don't know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you not know- Mueller comes at him, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he'll be there.    Either way, we have to go. Kendall nods, slowly.   The two start up the hill.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can carry him if you want. He and Kendall continue on. Mueller lingers a moment longer and then turns, following them up the hill. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- LAST NIGHT Kendall, Childs, and Mueller make their way through the bush. The WIND and RAIN have conspired into a FULL BLOWN HURRICANE. The three men are practically stumbling now, leaning in against it to stay on their feet. Kendall spies something through the maelstrom. It looks like WET WOOD. He points:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The trio stumble towards the front door... INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Obviously abandoned. Bare of any furniture save for two wooden chairs next to an empty fireplace. DUNBAR and NUNEZ shout in surprise as the three men practically collapse into the cabin. Dunbar runs to bolt the door against the elements as Nunez helps them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We finished the course and came here, Then heard an explosion- (to Mueller) Where's Pike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know. West is dead. Silence. Dunbar and Nunez stare at him.    Mueller jerks a hand towards Kendall and Childs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They found him. Poor fucker was Practically blown in half-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor fucker my ass...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better watch it, faggot, I'm not Sure you and Childs didn't do him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you, wandering around Alone? At least we have an alibi-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike and I got separated-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah and he doesn't know when-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember now, it was before the Explosion-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you remember now-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm about two seconds away from seeing If fairies really can fly-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Pike? Mueller stops, as the others turn towards the big man. Silence. They realize what the question means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't kill anybody. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, bullshit, he's a fucking convict. You know how much he hated West-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hated West, Childs hated West, everyone with a goddamn brain hated West but that doesn't mean we killed him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it wasn't one of us?    What if it was a local-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was blown up by a phosphorous grenade, they don't exactly sell those at 7-11.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, here are the facts - Roberto was with Dunbar, Queen Kendall was with Childs, and Pike's the only one not here. He did it! The others nod, becoming convinced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is the only one unaccounted for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he's dead too.    Maybe you killed Them both, Mueller-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. (to Mueller) Let me see your grenades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were each given three so whoever killed West will be missing one. Mueller angrily digs into his sack and pulls out his grenades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See?   Three.     Now can we please- He stops. Hearing a SOUND outside.        Through the wind and rain, FOOTSTEPS on the porch. They all turn to the door.       Waiting... The DOOR SWINGS OPEN.. Pike.       Covered in BLOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, guys. They stare at him as he calmly closes the door and walks over to the empty FIREPLACE. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose blood is that, Jay?       West's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any kindling for afire? He looks around for kindling.       A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, West's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean I killed him. (pause) Isn't that what we all wanted? INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY HARDY He admitted it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right in front of us. Mueller went after him but we held him back. Pike surrendered and volunteered to be tied up. So we roped him to a chair and tried to ride out the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would he just surrender? Kendall turns to her and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he had a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CABIN -- LIVING ROOM -- LAST NIGHT Pike, tied to a chair by the fireplace while the others look for, food in the KITCHEN. Alone, Kendall walks past Pike:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Kendall, talk to you for a sec? Kendall looks around - there seems no harm in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hated West as much as I did. I'm not saying what I did was right, but you can't tell me you're not glad the motherfucker's dead. Kendall says nothing. Pike looks around, makes sure no one is listening and then whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thing is, we've got a real opportunity here. You turn me in Tomorrow and we're both fucked-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gay Senator's son who let his Sarge get fragged on a training exercise? The press'll crucify you and your father. His career will be over and it'll be your fault. But we do this different and you come out a hero. On Kendall, thinking about it.    A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mueller.    He's as bad as West and we both know   it. Now I can't do it, cause I'm   tied up, but we get the others to   go along-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think I want to hear this-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone else can do the deed, it doesn't have to be you. Maybe Nunez too, he's got a tendency to follow Mueller, but the rest of us can come out ahead - the guys who took out their Sergeant's killers! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll   move the bodies out to the creek   and say we came over the hill right   as they fragged West, all we gotta   do is tell the story right. Kendall stares at him.   Disgusted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sick, Pike. He turns and walks away.   Pike watches him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later on I.saw him talking to Dunbar. They had been close. I was in another room when it happened. INT. CABIN -- KITCHEN LAST NIGHT Kendall, looking through the empty cabinets for food when A GUNSHOT -- From the living room. As Kendall bolts towards the noise, the air is filled with the sounds of SCREAMING and SHOOTING! He pushes through the door... INT. CABIN -- LIVING ROOM -- LAST NIGHT Kendall, coming through the door as we SLO-MO... Mueller, sprawled out on the floor, dead... Pike, tied to the chair, bullethole in his forehead... Nunez, wounded, stumbling out the front door into the hurricane... And a badly wounded Childs, pistol out, TURNING towards the SOUND OF THE DOOR and FIRING... Kendall's arm, HIT with a SLUG, and he starts to go down... FREEZE-FRAME -- On Kendall's form, falling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think he meant to do it. It was just reflex - he'd already been gutshot. I must have passed out cause next thing I knew... EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- DAWN The sounds of RUNNING  and HEAVY BREATHING. Kendall's eyes flutter open. He's on   Dunbar's back, being carried through the woods. The sound   of GUNFIRE and a TREE BRANCH SHATTERS next to them. Someone   is chasing them. Trying to kill them. Nunez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dunbar bobs and weaves as another volley of bullets comes from behind and we can now hear ROTOR BLADES APPROACHING... EXT. CLEARING -- DAWN As Dunbar bursts into the sunlight, carrying Kendall. The entire thing dreamlike, what we saw at the opening, but from KENDALL'S VIEWPOINT -- the helicopter overhead, Nunez behind, Dunbar turning and shooting, NUNEZ GOING DOWN... INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY KENDALL And that's it. Hardy is silent.    Staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nunez was chasing Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he'd shot Mueller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't see it, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I said, I was in the kitchen. When I came out, Mueller and Pike were dead, Nunez and Childs were hit and Dunbar was gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did he come back for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I honestly don't know. Maybe to have someone to cover for him. And I wish I could, but there's no doubt in my mind he killed those men. Silence.   Kendall's got nothing more to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I think that's it.     He rises and walks to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hardy? Hardy turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did Dunbar tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hardy smiles and pushes out the door... EXT. STYLES' OFFICE -- DAY Hardy and Osborne stand before the Colonel, filling him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike killed West, Dunbar killed Mueller, Childs, and Nunez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who killed Pike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone must have got a shot off. He wasn't exactly a moving target. Styles turns to Osborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too neat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Too neat." How long have you been an investigator?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that has anything to do with-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That means under a year. Let me explain what ten years of police work has taught me - murder is basic. There are no conspiracies, no grand mysteries, and no evil puppet masters behind it all, pulling the strings; murder is shitty people doing a shitty thing to other shitty people - it doesn't always make sense but it's always neat. Dunbar's our guy. Osborne struggles to put it into words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just... He came back for Kendall. I don't think he's capable of murder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone's capable of murder, Osborne. Osborne turns, making her case to Styles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, all we've got is what Kendall says, and he didn't actually witness any deaths except Nunez. He found West, he saw Mueller and Pike, but just their bodies - he didn't see any crime committed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sure if he'd known this was all going to happen he'd have Tried harder to witness it for you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West's body isn't in the creek bed. They stop arguing, turning to look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've already been over the terrain twice. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a hurricane, Bill, the wind probably moved it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Habeas Corpus - you have to have a body to have a crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, then let's widen the search 'to include the endzone in Giants Stadium and the trunk of my car-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without the body we have no physical proof. We need a confession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Dunbar? I hate to break this to you, but I don't think he's gonna be all that psyched to put himself in for the death penalty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nevertheless-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nevertheless what'? Kendall will testify and that'll be enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me. A beat. Almost accusingly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean not enough to save you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets here in three hours.   Try for the confession. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- DAY Dunbar looks up as Hardy and Osborne enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cheerfully) Hey, Ray! Just had a nice talk with your buddy. Kendall - seems you killed three people!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That son of a bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'd be my reaction too-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, why didn't you say so? We'll Just drop all your charges, then-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious- Hardy leans across the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck "you're serious", Raymond, you got exactly zero truck with us; right now we'd take the word of a crackhead over yours, so if you've got something to say, say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Kendall tell you about the PX?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he worked there-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, did he tell you about it?   About the business Childs ran?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pills, shots, you name it, Basic's a lot easier when you don't feel pain-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Childs made some side money, so what? People are dead, Ray, and the only one we have to blame is you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't shoot West-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we know, Pike did. Dunbar stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you know everything, don't you? You haven't even scratched the surface. Hardy leans across the table, looks Dunbar dead in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know enough to know you got two choices - you can sign a confession, in which case you'll probably spend the rest of your life in a military prison, or you can tell us to fuck off, in which case you'll probably get the gas chamber. (smiling) Am I scratching your surface yet? Dunbar stares at him for a moment and then LAUNCHES HIMSELF at Hardy, SCREAMING. Tackles him to the floor, CHOKING HIM... Osborne, pulling her sidearm, and PISTOL WHIPPING Dunbar in the head! Dunbar goes sprawling off Hardy as M.P.'s rush into the room, RESTRAINING him. Hardy gets up, gasping, and stumbles to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardy! But he's already gone. INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- CORRIDORS -- DAY Hardy, walking angrily towards the front entrance, wheezing and massaging his neck. Osborne, runninq to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the fuck wasn't he in restraints?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Styles appears at the end of the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, where are you going-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home, I'm done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the confession? Hardy stares at him. ..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want a confession? Why don't you confess, Bill: people are dead and you don't give a shit about it! Only reason you called me is to protect your fucking job, you know this is your fault-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you talking about-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about West! We had him, Bill, we were there. You're the fucking Base Commander, you knew what he did to Cadets and you let him go on the way he always he has- Styles couldn't reassign him, he's a legend-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew what he was capable of and you just stood by. It was just a matter of time till somebody fragged his ass, and you know what? He deserved it. There's your confession. He pushes past a shocked Styles and walks out the door. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- PARADE GROUNDS -- DAY Hardy storms across the grass.   Osborne, still following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, Hardy, you can't just leave-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you owed Styles and now you're gonna turn your back on him? Hardy whirls on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West was a monster! Fifteen years ago, I was here, I was Section Eight, I was Pike. Fuck being the knife dummy- that thing he did, stripping Pike down, making him stand outside all night? He did that every year, he did that to me. Fifteen years ago, I wanted him dead, and now I'm supposed to care that somebody offed him? Sorry, no can do. I tried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did more than try. You cracked Dunbar in less than three minutes, as an investigator you're phenomenal-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phenomenal at taking bribes, right? A beat.   Osborne shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was starting to believe you, you know? That you weren't who everyone Said. I guess I was wrong-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, spare me the reverse psychology bullshit! This isn't my "great second chance", Osborne. Everyone thinks I'm a piece of shit cop who took money and nothing is going to change that. Nobody will ever know what happens here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you will. Hardy stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you care?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's my job. Because people are dead. Because of the whole honor and duty thing, make a difference in the world, crap like that. (pause) We can do this, Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hardy looks at the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two and a half hours. That's all I'm asking. Two and a half hours to maybe get the truth. Silence. Hardy looks back up at her.     Speaking softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't shoot West...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar... He said he didn't shoot West. West wasn't shot, Kendall said he was blown apart by a phosphorous grenade and Dunbar never saw the body. They stare at each other for a moment... INT. COFFEE ROOM -- DAY Hardy and Osborne enter to find Dunbar in SHACKLES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apologize-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw West's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The creek bed-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he'd been shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the phosphorous grenade?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One went off, yeah, but it didn't Touch him- I thought you knew this-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell it to me. INT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED -- LAST NIGHT Dunbar and Nunez RUNNING towards the glow of phosphorous and sound of GUNFIRE. They come over the hill to see Childs and Kendall, standing over WEST'S BODY. Dunbar stops, shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy fuck... Holy fuck, what the fuck did you guys do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found him like this... Dunbar edges closer, looking at West.   With BULLET HOLES. His chest, riddled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody emptied a full clip into him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT DAY HARDY Kendall told us Mueller was the one who found them with West's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying, then. We didn't see Mueller till we got to the cabin. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Dunbar, Kendall, Childs, and Nunez push through the door to find Mueller in his undershirt, a FIRE burning in the hearth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breathing hard) West...he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back up. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT DAY OSBORNE Mueller was alone in the cabin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT MUE:LLER Pike and I got separated... then I heard gunfire. Close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did we.   Why didn't you come? Mueller looks down, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid... Mueller voice FADES OUT as he continues to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't buy it. But Mueller had all three of his grenades. Mueller shows his three grenades to the others. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT DAY OSBORNE At least you and Kendall agree on that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened next?     Dunbar shudders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike came back. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Pike, staggering in through the door. The others get up from where they are sitting - it's been awhile since they arrived. Pike shouts at Mueller:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck happened to you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck happened to you? One minute you're next to me and the next you're gone and the sky lights up like fucking Christmas-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been, Jay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wandering through a hurricane trying to find this place. It's gettin' bad out there- (looking around) Where's West?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. (to Pike) West's dead. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Silence.   All of them staring at Pike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been, Jay? Pike, suddenly understanding.      Fear creeping into his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. . . no, fuck that- He moves to the door, but. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Nunez, with his PISTOL out.      Trained on Pike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roberto, what the fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just want to check your pack-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever shot the Sarge blew a grenade first-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blame the nigger, then, huh? Someone turns up dead, you just look for the Darkest face in the crowd-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it's not like that-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I? The CLICK as Nunez pulls back the pistol's hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him check your pack. Pike stares at them and then throws his pack down, angrily. Dunbar goes to it, opens it, and reaches in. Pulls his hand out. Only TWO GRENADES. Looks at Pike. Sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tie him up. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Later. The fury of the storm has increased. Kendall, Childs, Nunez, and Mueller, in the KITCHEN looking for food. IN THE LIVING ROOM Pike, tied to the chair. Dunbar sitting in a corner, listening to the hurricane rage outside. Pike watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like the first day, huh?    You standing guard on me. A CREAKING as the cabin SHIFTS on it's foundation.   Dunbar looks up at the roof, scared. It holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place ain't gonna hold much longer. Dunbar doesn't reply. Still staring nervously at the roof. Pike looks to make sure the others out of earshot, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and me are friends, right? No reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Pike takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta untie me. (off Dunbar's look) I didn't do this thing, Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hated West more than any of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe, but that don't make me a killer-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the only one missing a grenade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which anyone coulda taken out of my gear on the chopper. Were you watching your pack on the ride in? Dunbar starts to get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray, this is my life    here. I ain't gonna pretend I'm not    happy West is gone, but you know I    couldn't have done this. It's not     in me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If not you, then who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mueller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sweeping our area and suddenly he's gone. Couple minutes later, phosphorous grenade pops off about a third of a click away-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's exactly what he says about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you gonna trust, Ray?    Him or your friend? Dunbar stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hated West, Mueller loved him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough to go to prison? Childs' PX Scam, Mueller was in on it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look in my pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just look.   Little pocket. Dunbar walks over to Pike's pack and unzips it.    Checks the little pocket. Pulls out a VIAL and a SYRINGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Combat grade morphine.    Mueller sold it to me. .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lying-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull up my sleeve.    Right arm. Dunbar does to reveal a cluster of TRACK MARKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That look like a lie to you? I been using solid for the last eight weeks. Dunbar sits down.   Not knowing what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After that first night on the parade Grounds with you, I was bad - Exposure, malnutrition, the works. I needed something to keep me from crashing. Mueller found me. INT. CADET SHOWERS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO Empty except for Pike. He sits, nude, curled up on the tile, as the nozzles blast STEAMING WATER down onto his shivering form. FOOTSTEPS approaching. Mueller. He leans down next to Pike, speaking to him. Kindly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he knew guy who had an in at the PX, could hook me up. This is before I knew what a dick he was. As Mueller produces a SYRINGE from his pocket... INT. BASE PX -- BACKROOM -- SIX WEEKS AGO A covert meeting among stacks of supplies. Childs stands with Mueller, talking to a gaunt Pike. Behind Pike are a group of other SICKLY LOOKING CADETS, all jonesing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later on Childs got assigned there, started running the shit out to every cadet who needed it. But I was our class's first customer.. . Pike hands the smiling Mueller a WAD OF CASH... INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Dunbar staring open mouthed at Pike.    Shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why... why didn't you tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Becoming a morphine addict during Basic ain't exactly something you want to broadcast. Only Mueller and Childs know. A beat.   Dunbar gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That still doesn't mean you didn't kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw West, right?   How was he killed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full clip to the body-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From up close or far away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His chest was hamburger-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's close range. You go full auto on a guy from close range, you're gonna be swimming in blood. Look at my uniform. Nothing. Dunbar looks.   Not a speck of blood on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where's Mueller's? When I came in, he was only wearing a t-shirt. Dunbar looks over to fireplace, where ashes are smoldering... FLASHCUT TO - When Dunbar first entered the Cabin: Mueller, standing there in a T-SHIRT, a FIRE burning in the hearth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Way I figure it, West must have found out about their little business and was gonna bust them, so they decided to get rid of him first...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) They?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mueller and Childs. One of them must've taken the grenade from my pack on the chopper... INT. TRANSPORT HELICOPTER (FLYING) -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT The Sectioners sit, stonefaced, staring out the window. CLOSE ON - Mueller's hand as it snakes into Pike's pack and extracts a phosphorous grenade. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Mueller and Pike, twenty feet apart, scouring the brush for targets. Mueller looks to Pike and then slips away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Mueller ditches me during the exercise and heads for the creek. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED,-- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Mueller stands on the hill and pulls the grenades pin, tossing it down the embankment. ..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He blows the grenade to frame me and gets West to come running... . The grenade BLOWS, setting the entire area AGLOW... EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Kendall and Childs, turning towards the sound... Note: Each shot of Kendall and Childs in this sequence should correspond exactly to Kendall's Flashback. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED -- NIGHT West emerges from the bush at a sprint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is going on?! Mueller runs down the embankment toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know, sir, I- Six feet away from West, Mueller suddenly raises his rifle and PULLS THE TRIGGER. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Kendall and Childs, running in the direction of the grenade...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs' job is easy, he only has to delay Kendall long enough for Mueller to get away. Suddenly MACHINE GUNFIRE shatters the night!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He tackles Kendall into the mud. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Mueller, smoking rifle in hand, uniform covered in blood stands over WEST'S DEAD BODY. He turns and runs off INTO THE BRUSH. A moment later, Childs and Kendall come into view at the top of the embankment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now all Mueller has to do is get rid of the evidence... INT. CABIN -- EARLIER LAST NIGHT Mueller, still covered in blood, enters the dark cabin. He strips of his shirt and throws it in the fireplace. Striking a match, igniting the bloody rag... .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And wait for everyone else to arrive. Mueller, watching the evidence burn... INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Pike sighs, finished with his story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What don't you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a lot of information to be Getting... I have to think-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The hurricane outside GROWING LOUDER as the Cabin ROCKS again. The sound of WOOD SNAPPING. Pike stares up at the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no time to think, Ray, we gotta get out of here! You untie me, we grab the guns, get Kendall and Nunez, and make a run for it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... no, we can just wait till we get back and then tell the M.P.'s-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We wait and I'm a dead man. I got a black face, a criminal record, and over a hundred other cadets who'll testify how much I hated West - my court martial will take six minutes. It's either me or them, Ray, and you gotta decide right now. The cabin SHIFTS again.     Dunbar stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Untie me. Dunbar doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Untie me, Ray. A long beat.   The two men stare at each other. And then Dunbar pulls his knife from his boot and leans down to cut Pike's bonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing? Dunbar freezes.   Caught. He looks to the open kitchen door where Mueller stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys, get out here! The others enter the room. Dunbar, kneeling there, knife inches away from severing Pike's ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place is going, Mueller.     We gotta move-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut the fuck up. (to the others) He was gonna cut him loose. The others stare at Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause I didn't do it. Childs motions to Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from there. He's serious.    Dunbar moves away from Pike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all know what you did, Pike. I don't know what kind of nigger voodoo You been working in here, but-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your shirt, Mueller?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used it to start the fire-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still got mine on, not a speck of blood on it. Not a bad trick for a murderer- you said you burned yours? The others begin to look at Mueller with new eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was freezing from the hurricane-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you took off your shirt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To start a fire, goddammit! (pointing to Pike) What about him, huh? Maybe he offed the Sarge and changed shirts, brought an extra one in his pack. Y'ever think of that? Go ahead, cut him loose! First chance he gets, he'll waste the rest of us, that's how they work- The hurricane, reaching FEVER PITCH outside as WATER begins leaking in through the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, Ray, we gotta get out of Here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going anywhere. PIKE TURNS TO MUELLER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cadet Michael Mueller, I hereby place you under military arrest for the Murder of Sergeant Nathan West-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fuck are you talking about-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are to be stripped of all weapons And placed under guard-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until we return to base, and ballistics can match your weapon to the slugs in Sergeant West's body-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Mueller pulls his SIDEARM and POINTS IT AT PIKE.
direction.name: direction
