direction.raw_text: Mueller, what the fuck-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do this- Pike, EYES LOCKED with Mueller.    Continuing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A test will no doubt link you to the Killing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to shut up-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -failure to comply with this arrest is a court martialable offense in and of itself-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike, please-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Although that won't matter much when Coupled with the murder charge-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stupid white trash motherfucker, I saw you do it- And Mueller FIRES. Pike's head SNAPS BACK. The gunshot, DEAFENING.    Then, for an eternity, SILENCE. Nobody moves.   Nobody breathes.   As if time has stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.. . my God... Mueller lowers his arm, the pistol clattering to the floor. His face, as shocked as the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't... stop talking... He takes a step forward towards Pike.    A hole in the middle of the black man's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) So you killed him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . . . Almost mechanically, Dunbar begins to reach for his own gun... The unmistakable sound of a two rifles' magazines being RACKED simultaneously. Dunbar turns to see Childs and Nunez, their M-16's in hand. Levelled at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that hand away. Dunbar does.    Looks to Nunez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can still come out of this okay. Pike got free, he got a gun, he came after us. That's the story. Mueller collapses on the ground.   Head in hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West was one thing, but this-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Mueller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You framed-him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of that matters now. We got two dead bodies and a story that explains them. You're either with us, or against us - which is it? Dunbar and Kendall, looking at each other. It's clear what the wrong answer will mean. A long beat, until
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay- He is cut off as the WIND outside ROARS - the HURRICANE mounting to it's FULL FORCE - and the WINDOWS BLOW INWARDS, showering Childs, Mueller, and Nunez with glass! Dunbar's hand flies to his pistol, PULLING IT... Mueller, SCREAMING, trying to claw the glass from his EYES... Childs, seeing Dunbar move, PULLS THE TRIGGER. .. . And the cabin is filled with the THUNDER OF GUNFIRE as Kendall goes down, clutching his ARM... DUNBAR FIRES, hitting Childs directly in the chest... Childs, still shooting, falls back, his random spray of bullets PUNCHING INTO MUELLER who jerks like a marionette... Nunez, drawing a bead on Dunbar, about to shoot, when... A great CRESCENDO of WOOD SPLINTERING and SUPPORTS BUCKLING overtakes them and the CABIN'S ROOF COMES DOWN ON THEIR HEADS. EXT. DEMOLISHED CABIN -- FIRST LIGHT Hours later. The rain has lessened and the Hurricane has begun to lift as Dunbar pulls himself from the debris. Hearing a FAINT CRY from his left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kendall.   Half conscious, his arm, bloody. Dunbar slings the man across his shoulders as the rising sun begins to peak through the clouds overhead. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- SUNRISE Dunbar, carrying Kendall towards the clearing when GUNFIRE comes from behind. He turns to look... Nunez. The only other survivor from the Cabin. A hundred yards back, rifle in hand, coming after them with a vengeance. Dunbar, sprinting towards the clearing, bullets at his heels and as he bursts from the tree line he looks up to see a HELICOPTER OVERHEAD DUNBAR (V.O.) And then I killed the last of them. FLASHCUT TO - Nunez, chest blown open, going down... INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT DAY And we're back to the interrogation. Dunbar, stubbing out a cigarette and looking up at Hardy and Osborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have some coffee? Osborne blinks, like a trance has been broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... yeah, sure. She goes over to the machine and pours a cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shot Childs and Nunez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They would have killed us both. You want me to write a confession, I'll write a confession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saved Kendall's life-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not Pike's. Osborne hands him the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell us all this in the first place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you have believed me? Their faces say "no".   Osborne spreads a MAP out on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the cabin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know on a map. West told us it was there, we just found it. Maybe the hurricane took it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond, for you to have any chance of coming out of this, we need to locate the other bodies and examine them to corroborate your testimony. Otherwise this is just another story-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hardy, I joined the army for college money. I didn't ask for any of this - I tried to do the right thing out there and people got killed. You say finding those bodies'll help me, then go find them. I don't want to die. EXT. FOR MCKINLEY -- CORRIDORS -- DAY Hardy and Osborne, walking and talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk it through: Childs, Mueller, and Nunez know they're going out on the regular Tuesday Night drill, hurricane or ho hurricane, so they plan it: Kill West, pin it on Pike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they're smart about it. They know when you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy and for that to work, you have to have a witness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly, someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned. You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe, so when the time comes, they've totally bought into your version of events.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They believe the innocent are guilty and the guilty are innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the, world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it's a good plan but it goes wrong; Mueller flips out and shoots their fall guy, which means they have to bring Dunbar and Kendall into the Cover story-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kendall maybe would have agreed, but The hurricane buttfucks the cabin-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buttfucks the cabin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And all hell breaks loose. A lot of Good guys shoot a lot of bad guys and whiz, bang, zoom, happy ending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why, after Dunbar drags Kendall out from under a house, does the Senator's son try and get us to put his savior in the gas chamber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That bugs you too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go talk to Bill... INT. STYLES' OFFICE -- DAY Hardy and Osborne stand in front of an agitated Styles. He tries to take a hit off his asthma inhaler and gets nothing. Frustrated, he tosses it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking asthma... This whole thing's driving it nuts. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I said before-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was dead right. You think Dunbar's on the level?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does Osborne agree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir, I do. Hardy lays a piece of paper on Styles' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar's confession. It should be enough to get you out of trouble. Styles looks at it and then slowly up to Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want Kendall, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to burn Dunbar to us. You don't do that if you're not involved. Hardy nods, agreeing.   Styles stares at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You both know if you do this, if you go after a Senator's son and you're wrong... it's not just me in the hot seat anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Hardy) I'm giving you a chance to walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know. Styles nods and looks to his desk.      Almost to himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't get to be a Colonel without compromising. Without getting out of the way of the bigger dogs. You politic, play it safe, think of the career first. And when things get dirty, you just look the other way... He looks back up at Hardy.      His eyes, steeled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four of my men are dead. You think Kendall had something to do with it, then you go get the son of a bitch. INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- DAY Kendall lies in his bed, looking worse than before.   Hardy and Osborne enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike never confessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been making progress, I see. Osborne looks to her watch.   Kendall notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running out of time, are we? Tick- Tock, tick-tock, how long till your witnesses fly the coop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much time to solve the crime. Tell me, detective, how did it feel taking blood money from Guissepe Torres? Did it weigh on your conscience or did you just not think about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tried to pin three stone murders on Dunbar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many murders did you cover up? One? Five? Maybe an even ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Osborne) Can I go to jail for punching a guy who's been shot? Kendall begins coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they're giving me the wrong medicine. This isn't a very good Hospital, you know- Hardy sighs and goes to the sink to get him some water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Epileptic attacks are murder on your system. Rattle your internal organs like a paint mixer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My heart weeps. He returns with a GLASS OF WATER and hands it to Kendall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike never confessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but it got you interested, didn't it? Got you to dig. Inspired Ray to tell you terribly sordid tales about drugs and creek beds and dead little sergeants who stuck their noses where they didn't belong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's that word again. (smiling) As I told you, I wasn't in the room when everyone started shooting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar says you were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he's mistaken. You know, I really don't think my father would approve of this line of questioning-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you tell us he shot everybody, Levi? You put him in for three murders, the man saved your life-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I should stay silent about his misdeeds? The guns went off, I ran in, Childs shot me, Pike and Mueller were dead, and Dunbar was running out the door with the smoking gun-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar was running out the door? Ohhhhhh... See that's where I was confused, because I thought you said Nunez was running out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I said Dunbar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. You know, I really thought you said Nunez. I thought you said "Dunbar was gone," My fault, I gotta check the tape on that. (off Kendall's look) Oh, yeah we taped the last interview. This one too. Cause it'd be a real break for us to catch you in a lie. Silence. They wait for Kendall's reaction. He looks momentarily flustered by this... and then he smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe your next line is "What are you trying to hide?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to disappoint. I'm on painkillers for the injury - they cloud the mind. You're right, it was Nunez. Any more questions? Hardy doesn't know what to say.   That was his ace card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get me wrong, Mueller and Childs were quite the pair, the type of guys you didn't feel comfortable going to sleep around. Completely capable of murder. But as I said, I didn't hear the exchange before the shooting. I wasn't in the room. Osborne furrows her brow at this as Hardy continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar will testify that you were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we'll leave it up to the courts - His word against mine. What does his father do again? Steelworker? (smiling) Doesn't matter, I'm sure justice will be served. In any case, my father will definitely want to talk to you about all these questions, these accusations on his son. He's quite protective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Osborne turns to Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to talk to you outside. EXT. BASE HOSPITAL -- CORRIDOR -- DAY Osborne and Hardy, exiting the room.      Whispering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're fucked, I know-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got their stories straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Kendall said - "the type of guys you don't feel comfortable going to sleep around." That's what Dunbar said about Childs to the letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Positive.    Hardy, they planned this. She grins.    He grins back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad for hostile and uncooperative, eh? INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- DAY Hardy and Osborne reenter, smiling.      Kendall chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something funny, Levi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just thinking of what's going to happen to your careers when my father gets through with you. Hardy pulls the out MICRORECORDER and hands it to Osborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you talk to Levi off the record for a second?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Smiling, she stops the tape.    Then turns to Kendall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Dunbar got your stories straight. Little details, little inconsistencies, designed to bounce us back from one of you to the other, asking questions, killing time, until the transport arrives and whisks you away to where Senator Daddy can protect you. You think you're just going to slide out of this? You're an accessory to murder, Levi, you're Going to jail-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't threaten me-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jail if he's lucky, the gas chamber if he's not-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't do anything- Osborne laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter, Levi. We're going to find those bodies and when we do, I'm going to make sure one of them has a bullet in them that matches your weapon-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a fantastic idea-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I just take your gun to the morgue and fire it into one of their skulls; then I call every newspaper in the country with the story about how Senator Kendall's gay son went nuts on a training mission-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beginning to panic) It won't work-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will and you know why? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're not a person anymore, you're a cadet in the United States Army; you have no identity, no Miranda warning, and no rights. So I'm gonna throw you to the wolves, and unlike you I'm gonna get away with it, because you're pissing me off! She finishes, breathing hard. Kendall, totally cowed. Hardy, trying to suppress a smile. Osborne rises for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enjoy your flight to Washington-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What. Silence.   Kendall takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar's telling the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong answer-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did get our stories straight, but not because we killed anyone. (pause) It was because I threatened him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because of what I saw. (pause) Who really killed West. Osborne holds up the microrecorder and starts the tape again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who killed Sergeant West? Kendall stares at the recorder.   A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who, Levi-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I was standing next to him. He pauses, taking a shaky sip of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in on the PX thing. He and Mueller and me, we were making thousands. West found out. Childs said we were just gonna scare him - Use my Dad's clout. I had this whole speech prepared about how if he ratted us, his career was over. We met him in the creek bed but before I said anything... EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- CREEK BED -- LAST NIGHT West stands in front of Childs and Kendall, facing them. Kendall opens his mouth to speak, but Childs steps forward and raises his rifle, FIRING... INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY KENDALL I swear, I didn't know he was gonna do it. After, he told me we were gonna pin it on Pike, one of our biggest customers. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT As they TIE PIKE to the, chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody'd believe the word of a black junkie ex-con against ours. Childs gives Kendall a look that says "Stay quiet".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me I'd better keep quiet, or I'd end up the same as West. Pan over to Dunbar, who binds his friend, sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar didn't know anything about any of it. Everything he told you was true, except after...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- LAST NIGHT Dunbar pulls Kendall from the cabin's wreckage. As Kendall begins to talk to him, Dunbar's eyes widen in shock. ..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him what had really happened to West. Told him to keep quiet about it or I'd destroy him. Because if it came out that I was involved with the whole PX scam, my father would be finished. INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY KENDALL I scared Dunbar into silence.  He's been trying to cover for me the whole time. We got here, you came to  see me... I didn't know if I could trust him with that kind of secret-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you framed him. The same way Childs was going to frame Pike. Kendall nods.   Crying a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little advice, Levi, next time you frame a guy, pick someone who can't defend themselves. Kendall says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened with Nunez?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came after us. And I told Dunbar he had to kill him... EXT. CLEARING -- EARLIER THAT MORNING The helicopter, hovering overhead. Dunbar, carrying Kendall, spinning his rifle to face Nunez, sixty yards away. Dunbar hesitates before firing, not wanting to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it! Dunbar's rifle ERUPTS... INT. KENDALL'S HOSPITAL ROOM -- PRESENT DAY KENDALL And he did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kendall finishes, wiping his face.    Osborne turns to Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how you do good cop/bad cop. Hardy smiles and gets up.   Walking slowly to Kendall's bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs did it, huh? Kendall nods, still a little teary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First Pike, then Mueller, now Childs? When are we getting to the others? When are we gonna hear about Nunez? FLASHCUT TO - NUNEZ, in the creek bed, SHOOTING WEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or Dunbar? FLASHCUT TO - Now DUNBAR, SHOOTING WEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or you, Levi? When is it finally going to come out that you were the one who killed him? FLASHCUT TO - KENDALL, SHOOTING WEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you can't prove it! You can't prove anything until we find the bodies! Kendall, crying harder now, beginning to shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lied to us, Levi, you're going to the gas chamber unless you tell us where to find them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are they!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then. His mouth SLAMS SHUT. Teeth cracking together over and over again like a metronome on speed, and his body JERKS HORRIBLY, going horizontal, SHAKING VIOLENTLY! Osborne, leaping to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get something between his teeth! Hardy grabs a fork from the bedside table and tries to shove it into Kendall's chattering mouth. His teeth, CLAMPING DOWN on the metal and Hardy's hand, drawing blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! The Nurse bursts into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's an epileptic! The Nurse runs to the bed, pushing Hardy aside. As more MEDICAL PERSONNEL runs into the room, they usher Hardy and Osborne to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to have to wait outside-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a witness!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter, outside-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: F-F-F-F-F-F-Fuh- Osborne tries to move to him, but the Doctor blocks her path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trying to say something-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out, NOW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuh-Fuh-Fuh-Fuh-Fuh- Osborne knocks the Doctor down and runs to Kendall's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Kendall looks up, focusing on Osborne, a slight moment of clarity in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuh-Fucking Pike. And relapses into ANOTHER FIT as SECURITY GUARDS drag Hardy and Osborne from the room. INT. BASE HOSPITAL -- WAITING ROOM -- DAY Later.   Hardy and Osborne sit in silence, eyes downcast. Waiting. Hardy pulls his last cigarette from the pack, lights it, crumples the pack and tosses it into a garbage can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pushed him too hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You couldn't have known-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I could've.      Should've.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to get the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I didn't. I wanted to humiliate him. For what he did to Dunbar. For fucking over the little guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the falsely accused? Hardy looks up at her and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to break him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did I. She looks back to the floor. Hardy takes a drag from the cigarette, and then tosses that away too. The door opens and Styles walks into the room.    Somber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over.   Time of death was 4:42. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JAG's been notified and I called the Senator myself. My report will reflect that his medical condition made this unavoidable... you two had no culpability in the matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's horseshit and you know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. But it's my fault and I'll carry it. He sighs and takes a seat next to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found the cabin. Demolished, like they said. No bodies. Hurricane like that coulda scooped 'em up, dropped them down two counties over. We'll find them. Hardy says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you could explain all this to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know where to start. (pause) I guess it was about one man framing another. He thought if the other guy got blamed, people would over look his own wrong doings. Styles nods, understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens to Dunbar now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gets on his plane in ten minutes, which means you two are done. You'll understand if I don't walk you out. Hardy gets up to go and then stops.   Realizing something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're taking your command, aren't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Senator... He points to Kendall's hospital room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be. I'm not cut out to deal with the West's of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a good soldier, Bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said that wasn't a compliment. Hardy smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time it is. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- PARADE GROUNDS -- EVENING The sun, beginning to dip in the sky, as Hardy and Osborne exit the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your car's in the motor pool.     I'll walk you over. They walk in silence, for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think it'll work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. They pass a GROUP OF CADETS doing drills.    Hardy, watching them. Almost looking wistful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you never told me why you left the army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It dawned on me one day that we were supposed to be a nation founded on the principle of questioning authority... and all I did here was follow orders. It didn't add up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plus, I got kicked out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's gonna stay my secret. INT. MOTOR POOL -- EVENING Hardy and Osborne make their way towards Hardy's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were close to something with Kendall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe... Maybe we were nowhere near. Sometimes mysteries stay mysteries. (pause) I haven't by any chance grown on you, have I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, just making sure. Osborne turns to the DUTY SERGEANT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going need a vehicle release. The Sergeant nods, walking up with a clipboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign here and here. (recognizing them) Hey, ain't you the folks workin' on that whole hulabaloo from last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrible tragedy. One of those Section Eight boys worked in here. Pike. Heard he got out okay. Hardy signs the clipboard and hands it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hate to be the bearer of bad news, Sergeant, but he didn't make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Sergeant scratches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny. I swear I saw them bring him and the smaller guy in this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no that was Cadet Dunbar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean Ray Dunbar?     Well, that ain't right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw 'em get off the chopper.     White guys, right? Two
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am, Ray Dunbar's black. Hardy and Osborne stare at him.    Shocked A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I say something wrong-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Osborne) What runway's that transport leaving from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- PARADE GROUNDS -- EVENING CADETS SCATTER as Hardy's car ROARS OUT OF THE MOTOR POOL, PEELING across the grass towards the far side of the base! Hardy, white knuckling the wheel, doing his best to steer around anyone who can't get out of the way in time. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY RUNWAY FOUR -- EVENING A Large TRANSPORT PLANE sits on the runway waiting as three M.P.'s and a JAG LAWYER lead Dunbar/Pike (who, for purposes 0 continuity, we will continue to call DUNBAR) out to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The SQUEAL OF TIRES as Hardy's car SLIDES around the corner of the nearest building and SCREECHES to a halt by the plane. Hardy and Osborne, leaping out, running towards Dunbar and the M.P.s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk to him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Officer, we have a schedule To keep-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk to him now. Hardy grabs Dunbar by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not finished yet-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna bet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .P.'s, escort this man off the base!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) Sorry, detectives.     Time's up. As the M.P.'s grab Hardy, dragging him away. Osborne, trying to stop them. Dunbar, climbing the stairs onto the plane... Osborne pulls her SIDEARM, levelling it at him as Hardy yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James Randall Pike, COME ON DOWN! Dunbar stops at the hatchway. Slowly turning back to them. Seeing the gun. The M.P.'s release Hardy. Nobody moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go have a talk. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- EVENING Hardy and Osborne roughly lead Dunbar into the room, the JAG Lawyer trailing behind, shouting:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your entire career here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off. She slams the door and BARRICADES it.    Turns to Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got maybe three minutes till they break it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right back where we started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to talk about baseball now? Hardy practically throws Dunbar into a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more games, right, Pike?    It was you who West singled out... FLASHCUT TO - WEST on the parade grounds, now strangling DUNBAR on the first day...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You who got hooked by Mueller's morphine... FLASHCUT TO - Now DUNBAR in the showers as MUELLER hands him a syringe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You who did it all. Hardy steps forward and RIPS OPEN Dunbar's right sleeve, revealing the TRACK MARKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted revenge on West, revenge on them all, so you killed them. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT Dunbar standing in the Cabin; Mueller, Childs, and Pike, dead at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that wasn't enough. You needed a new identity, because no one was going to believe James Randall Pike, convicted felon, had acted so nobly in the face of danger - you needed a name people could trust, one that hadn't been to jail, one that hadn't publicly been West's bitch boy. He stares down at the bodies in the cabin, his eyes focusing on the black man's uniform. The name on it reads - "DUNBAR". As he reaches for it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT EVENING OSBORNE You kept Kendall alive to corroborate your story and he did it all they way up to the end. You even gave him his own motive in case we decided to burn him, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't do that now, though, can you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You walked into the army a convicted felon with a sentence of five years in a uniform and were going walk out eight weeks later with a different name, a clean record, and an honorable discharge - a guy who did "everything he could" to save his friends. Dunbar looks at them.   One to the other.   Slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what I did, now? And of course, you can prove all of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can prove that you're not Ray Dunbar. Impersonating a fellow Cadet is a court-martial in and of itself-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever claim I was Raymond Dunbar? Was I ever told to state my name rank and serial number for the record? No. You assumed who I was, because I was wearing this uniform. Don't believe me? He reaches under the table and rips out the HIDDEN MICROPHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check your tapes. Hardy and Osborne exchange an uneasy glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't need the tapes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you don't? What else do you have on me? You haven't found any bodies yet, have you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've found all of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dunbar chuckles at the bluff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhhh, I don't think so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a guess. Maybe they're not where they're supposed to be. Maybe somebody moved them. Habeas Corpus - no bodies, no crime, and Nunez still plays as self defense. Face it detectives ... you have nothing. Hardy, knowing he's right. In a flash he reaches down PULLS OSBORNE'S GUN and grabs Dunbar, SLAMMING him up against the wall, pressing the weapon TO HIS TEMPLE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not true, Cadet, I've got a gun-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (terrified) Jesus!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardy, what are you doing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this how your story goes? Pike annoys someone so much he gets shot in the head-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, please don't- A POUNDING on the locked door.    Hardy ignores it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can tie you to the chair if it'll work better for you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardy, for Chrissakes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (practically in tears) You'll never find it- Hardy COCKS the pistol as Dunbar screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll never find it cause HE'S NOT DEAD! A CRASH as the door's lock SNAPS and M.P.'s POUR into the room! Styles and the JAG Lawyer behind, taking in the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in God's name is going on? Hardy releases Dunbar, who slides to the floor, gasping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He- He made me do it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunting- we had to hunt him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant, arrest these men!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the exercise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There never was an exercise! Never targets, never teams, I don't even know if there's a creek bed out there- As the M.P.'s grab Hardy and Osborne, pulling them away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, what did you DO?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He breaks down sobbing.   Styles holds up a hand to the M.P.'s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I want to hear this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The JAG Lawyer glowers as the M.P.'s stand down.   Dunbar tries to pull himself together. To Hardy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. I was the one he singled out. Beat me morning, noon, and night, ran me ragged. When Mueller found me, I was gone. He gave me a little taste... INT. CADET SHOWERS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO Mueller showing the syringe to the naked Dunbar.   Dunbar's voice over speaks in unison with Mueller:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a friend with an in at the PX, can hook you up... INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT EVENING DUNBAR What I didn't know, was his friend was West. He ran the whole thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lying, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it's easy to have all that morphine just disappear without a higher up authorizing it? Check the requisition orders, I'll lay money it's his signature on them. INT. SECTION EIGHT BARRACKS -- EIGHT WEEKS AGO Dunbar, alone, sleeve rolled up, arm tied off: Sliding the needle into his vein...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was his game, see? Ride the cadets so hard they'd need something to stay on their feet. Then he'd send Mueller or Kendall to them, waving around their magic needle promising to make it all go away. He hits the plunger, injecting.   His face goes tranquil. INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT EVENING DUNBAR It wasn't a new thing either.   He'd been doing this for years. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every nine weeks, a new class of cadets, new potential customers. The amount of money involved over that period of time... this was some high stakes shit. He takes a deep breath, looking at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunbar moved his through the kitchen. I worked in the motor pool and hooked all the mechanics. By the time the hurricane hit, we were all in. Some using, some pushing, some both. But then something happened. West heard one of us was about to talk, to blow his whole operation. He figured he'd made enough money, had enough of the army, maybe it was time to disappear. But first he was gonna teach us one last thing. INT. SECTION EIGHT BARRACKS -- LAST NIGHT West, entering the,barracks, shouting the cadets awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tuesday Night drill was the perfect cover. The hurricane made it even better. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- TARMAC -- LAST NIGHT The cadets, climbing aboard the chopper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He put us on the chopper and flew us to his cabin. And then he told us. INT. CABIN -- LAST NIGHT The six men stand in rigid formation, eyes on West.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen! It has come to my attention that there is a traitor in our midst. Someone who was going to break the code of fraternal brotherhood that I have endeavored to create in all of you. Perhaps that failure is mine. But we take care of our own. And this traitor must be made to pay. He walks down the line of the six men, eyeing each of them. Finally stopping at one. Putting a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nunez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I wasn't-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you were. Cadet  Mueller found the letter you'd written to the Colonel in your locker.  You were going to betray us all.  Now, run. He points to the door. The hurricane, RAGING outside.   Nunez looks to the others, then the door, and understands. He takes off running out the door.       Gone. West walks over to a table covered with a tarp. Pulls the cloth aside to reveal M-16's, PISTOLS, and GRENADES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we'll see whose training's paid off the most. You are to hunt Cadet Nunez down and bring his body back to me. If you fail and he escapes, we all go down together. The remaining five cadets, understanding there is no place for friendship or kindness here. This is life and death. They walk to the table and gear up. EXT. LOUISIANA BAYOU -- LAST NIGHT Lightning, thunder, and rain as Nunez runs unarmed through the thick brush. SOMEWHERE BEHIND HIM - The other five fan out, rifles up, following his trail, ready to kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was insanity. We were hunting a man down to kill him. ON MUELLER Making his way down embankment, M-l6 out, ready for anything. From behind him, MOVEMENT...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got Mueller first. Nunez TACKLES HIM at full speed, feet SLIPPING on the wet hill, and the two TUMBLE head first into a GULLY. Punching, kicking, biting, anything to stop the other man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nunez, CHOKING Mueller as he strains to reach his gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roberto... With a HEAVE, Nunez SNAPS HIS NECK.        Mueller lies still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He took his gun. Used it on Childs. Nunez spins, seeing CHILDS BEHIND HIM. He DIVES as Childs fires! Hits the ground in a roll, comes up with Mueller's rifle, and SHOOTS - BLOWING CHILDS BACK against the wet rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't imagine what it was like. Having your friends try to kill you... Nunez slumps against the gully's wall, breathing hard.          In agony over what he's just had to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you do what you have to survive. Closing his eyes, Nunez steels himself. Wipes the blood from his hands and climbs out of the gully. ELSEWHERE PIKE, creeping through the foliage. Trying to listen for sounds of movement through the storm. His eyes narrow as he hears a HIGH PITCHED WHINE... The bullet hits his forehead dead center.        He crumples. PULL BACK TO REVEAL - Nunez in a tree, thirty meters away. Lowering his rifle.      He climbs down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kendall and I found Dunbar a couple minutes later. TIME CUT TO: Dunbar and Kendall come upon Pike's fallen form. They gaze down at the uniform emblazoned with the name "DUNBAR".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It came to me in a split second. Change clothes, change identities. If James Pike gets discharged he goes right back to jail. But if I was Dunbar, I could walk away from all this with a new life. But then... As he reaches down for the uniform, a SHOT RINGS OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KENDALL FALLS, wounded in the arm. Dunbar raises his rifle to find Nunez, standing ten yards away, gun trained on him. YELLING OVER THE HURRICANE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down! A Mexican stand-off.   The rain continues to fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to go! Nunez shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were gonna kill me, Pike!    Thought you were my friend! Dunbar, torn. He can't bring himself to shoot, but he can't surrender either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get Kendall to a hospital!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was gonna kill me too! Silence.   The two men still facing each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I snapped Mueller's neck! He was my best friend and I had to snap his neck because he was gonna shoot me for drugs! For West!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to do this! You go that way, I'll go this way! Nunez laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll shoot me in the back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed three people!    Isn't that enough for one night? More silence.   Neither moves.    The sky above, a maelstrom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to die out here, Roberto! Do you? Nunez, staring at him.     Deciding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you even twitch... Dunbar nods. Nunez begins backing away, rifle still trained on him. And then Dunbar spies something behind and to the left of Nunez... West. Staring down at him from behind some brush.       Watching. Nunez, slowly backing away. He pauses as his foot catches on a fallen branch. Looks away from Dunbar for a split second to step over it... West nods to Dunbar as if to say "Go on. . . " DUNBAR Forgive me. .. And Dunbar FIRES. Nunez, caught by the burst, GOES DOWN. The echo of the gunshots, swallowed by the storm. Dunbar lowers his head in agony. West walks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, Cadet Pike.      You get the gold star. Dunbar stares at his Sergeant through the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. West smiles.   Tilts his head to Kendall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd best get him out of here. Don't worry about the bodies, they'll be taken care of. Dunbar doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is where we part ways, Cadet. You tell them I died out here, or I'll come back for you. Tell them one of the others did me. Mueller, Childs, I don't care who. You and Kendall, you tell them a story. (smiling) You can tell a story, can't you? Dunbar doesn't reply.   West laughs and flips him a salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dismissed. And West turns and walks away, stepping over Nunez.   Giving Dunbar a clear shot at his back. Dunbar raises his rifle, wanting, needing, dying to shoot the old man... But he can't.   West disappears into the bayou. A GROAN from the ground. Kendall. Dunbar's reverie broken, he leans down, beginning to unbutton the Dunbar Uniform... INT. COFFEE ROOM -- PRESENT EVENING Dunbar stubs out a cigarette, finished. Hardy, Osborne, Styles, and the JAG Lawyer gaping at what he has just said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess Nunez wasn't dead after all. He came after us with a vengeance. (to Styles) You know the rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the bodies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't find them. Won't find West, either. He's too good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bodies, no West...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No death certificates.    No crime.
direction.name: direction

(looking at Hardy) We both should have died out there with our brothers. I know that now. Silence.   The JAG Lawyer looks to Hardy, all anger gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take him now if you don't mind. Hardy nods. Dunbar rises and slowly walks to the door. Turning back to Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, detective.   Did you get what you wanted? Hardy shakes his head, sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even close. They leave.   Styles walks over to Hardy.

direction.raw_text: Tom- Hardy holds up a hand, cutting him off. Styles nods, understanding, and leaves, closing the door behind him. Hardy and Osborne stand there.   Not speaking.    It's done. INT. FORT MCKINLEY -- OFFICER'S CLUB -- NIGHT Several hours and bourbons later, Hardy sits at the bar, drunk and alone. Out of place, the only one not in uniform. Osborne walks in, locates Hardy, and strides over to the bar, a sheaf of papers under her arm. Her face, stoic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven. He takes a slug of his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven guys. What was it you said? You were "just starting to believe I wasn't the guy people said". He chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven. That's the answer to Kendall's question. How many? Seven. Osborne looks at him.    Realizing what he's saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't the time-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the perfect time. You know what makes a good detective? The number of confessions they get. You're a good detective, Osborne. So now you get mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I don't want it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tough. He pours himself another drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thing about    taking money is, you don't have    to do anything.  You just sit there.     Maybe you don't return a phone call.     Maybe you don't follow up a lead.     But that's it.  Keep the money, your    work's done. Osborne stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven unsolved murders. And you know what? It didn't weigh on my conscience. Not one goddamn bit. He takes a slug from his glass and grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are degrees of truth, officer. Always degrees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a good man, Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far as I'm concerned, whatever you did in the past can stay in the past. Hardy stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may not be growing on you, but you're sure as hell growing on me. He motions to the bartender for another glass, but Osborne takes his hand, stopping him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And because you're a good man, I know you'll do the right thing. Hardy looks at her, questioning.   Osborne takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike never made it to D.C.. Somebody took him off the plane before it left. My guess is he's already dead. Hardy stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody saw.    But I don't think so. She puts the papers on the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the ones used to release the drugs to Mueller. West signed half of them - Pike was telling the truth. Look who signed the other half. She taps the bottom of the paper. Hardy, not wanting to believe it. He looks up at her, pained.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hardy stares at his glass.   Deciding.

direction.raw_text: Fuck it.   Let's go finish this. INT. STYLES' OFFICE -- NIGHT Styles, finishing his paperwork. He rises and turns off his desk light, bathing the office in DARKNESS. He's about to leave when he notices a SILHOUETTE in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You have to get out of the way of the bigger dogs". That was good. Styles squints at the figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, is that you? Hardy steps forward, into the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was so good, I actually forgot you're one of the bigger dogs now. The Base Commander. The one in control. You couldn't let him testify, could you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you let him testify then it would have all come out. West was supposed to take care of it out there, shut Nunez up and then disappear. But it got messy and people got killed. So you called your old pal Tom Hardy, figuring if worse came to worse, he'd cover for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're drunk-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to cover for you, Bill. Not for this. Styles, realizing what Hardy's talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look- He begins to move from behind his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay where you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or what?   You've gone round the bend-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West had a partner. Someone who knew how to get things done. Hardy throws the papers onto Styles' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I can't understand is why you signed these. If you'd just let West take care of the paperwork, no one would have known, but you got careless. So when Pike finally told the truth you had to get rid of him, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's preposterous-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toxicology report came back. Kendall's attack was caused by a drug known as anephadrine, maybe you've heard of it. It's for asthmatics. If an epileptic takes enough, it kills them. I checked with the nurses at the hospital - you're the only other person who visited Kendall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanted to see if he was okay-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You poisoned him, Bill. You heard our interrogation, you knew he was ready to crack, so you killed him, just like Pike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not even going to dignify that-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  You will stand there and you will listen! What happened to you, Bill?  You were the one who joined up to do good in the world. You were the one who believed in it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to get into a finger pointing contest about character? The army kicked you out for drugs, the cops fired you for taking bribes from a mobster, and you think you can stand there and lecture me on codes of conduct? There's only one criminal standing in this room and it's you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for long. He walks towards the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more witnesses. West's a ghost. But it doesn't matter because we have your signature, the hospital log, and Kendall's toxicology report. And that'll be enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't duck this, Bill. I may have done every goddamn thing in my life wrong but I won't let this happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the last time, I have no idea what you're talking about-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (squinting) Get your hands away from the desk! In the darkness we see Styles MOVE SUDDENLY...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Osborne, gun! Hardy DIVES to the floor - Osborne in the doorway, PISTOL raised, FIRES TWO SHOTS! Muzzle flare lighting the room for a split second as Styles is BLOWN BACK against the wall! Hardy gets to his feet and flicks on the LIGHT. Styles lies slumped in the corner, two holes in his chest. Dead. Osborne lowers her weapon, shaking. Hardy points to the top desk drawer, which is open. Inside it sits an IVORY HANDLED PISTOL. Fully loaded, safety off. It's presence tells them everything they need to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's West's, isn't it? Hardy nods and then turns to look down at Styles' body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it's over. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- PARADE GROUNDS -- NIGHT The aftermath. Flashing blue and red lights from parked Military Police vehicles illuminate the grounds as M.P. 'S string crime scene tape around the front entrance of the building, securing the site for investigation. Hardy takes in the entire scene from afar. Standing by his GTO, watching as several M.P.'s finish questioning Osborne. When she's done she spies Hardy and walks over to him.

direction.raw_text: What are you doing out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaving without saying goodbye. What are you gonna do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go home, get drunk, and try and forget this ever happened.

direction.raw_text: In case you need me to testify about the shooting. They'll clear you. A beat.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you. He turns away.   Walking towards his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Hardy! He turns back. She walks up and holds something out to him. A ten dollar bill.

direction.raw_text: I owe you this. He looks down at the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saved my life tonight. Keep it. (pause) Actually, don't keep it, I need the money. He takes the bill and Osborne laughs. He climbs into his car and starts it. Grinning at her through the open window.

direction.raw_text: You're one of the good ones, Osborne. Don't sweat the details. He puts the GTO in gear and drives off. She watches him go, then looks down at his card. Smiling. West's face fills the screen.

direction.raw_text: Welcome, Cadets. The art of warfare is simple and complex. Simple in its goal, complex in its execution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HARDY'S GTO (MOVING) -- NIGHT It's started to rain.    Hardy drives in silence.

direction.raw_text: As Sun Tzu writes, the true warfare is deception. A HITCHHIKER up ahead.    Hardy pulls over for him. INT. OSBORNE'S APARTMENT -- NIGHT Osborne, drinking and watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At all times you must confuse your enemies, surrounding them with uncertainty, giving them false hope. INT. HARDY'S GTO -- NIGHT The Hitchhiker gets into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna have to do a lot better than that, son.

Hardy grips the older man   by the shoulders, lowering him to the ground as he dies.    Whispering in his ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stem to sternum. You taught me well, Sarge. And WEST DIES. A moment of utter silence and then VOICES FROM THE PAST begin coming back to us:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you could explain all this to me? Kendall walks over to Hardy and hands him a PISTOL.

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know where to start. Kendall holds out his arm, gritting his teeth...

direction.raw_text: I guess it was about one man framing another... And Hardy SHOOTS Kendall once, THROUGH THE ARM. EXT. CLEARING -- THIS MORNING Mueller and Childs lay NUNEZ's DEAD BODY out in the brush. The sound of the Helicopter approaching... TIME CUT TO: Dunbar raises his rifle and FIRES towards the tree line. Aiming at nothing. The Helicopter comes into view overhead. DUST KICKS UP around Dunbar and Kendall - bullet hits.

direction.raw_text: When you commit a crime you know is going to be investigated, you need a fall guy.. . ON STYLES' FACE - Watching this through the windscreen.

direction.raw_text: The one who won't talk was trading live fire with the dead one as we reached the pick-up. RACK FOCUS TO - Hardy, concealed in the woods, FIRING at Dunbar and Kendall's feet to simulate Nunez shooting at them. Dunbar, shooting towards where Nunez's body lies. Making it look like he just killed Nunez. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- THIS MORNING Hardy arriving at the Fort, EMBRACING STYLES.

direction.raw_text: And for that to work, you have to have a witness... PAN OVER to OSBORNE, watching.

direction.raw_text: Someone who's not involved, who's word can't be questioned... VARIOUS SHOTS -- Of Hardy and Osborne, investigating the case, talking to Dunbar, talking to Kendall...

direction.raw_text: You only let them see what you want them to see, you make them believe...

direction.raw_text: They believe the innocent are guilty and the guilty are innocent. EXT. FORT MCKINLEY -- EARLIER After shooting Styles, Osborne gives her story to the M.P.'s.

direction.raw_text: And if they're asked, that's what they'll tell the world. INT. OSBORNE'S APARTMENT -- PRESENT NIGHT Osborne, watching the taped West.

direction.raw_text: Your greatest weapon will by your allies . . . INT. COFFEE ROOM -- EARLIER Hardy, taking a cigarette from Dunbar's pack.

direction.raw_text: Which brings us to the simple goal. For the true warrior, the one and only objective is to emerge from conflict unscathed.
